sen.j: 波多野 精一（はたの せいいち、1877年7月21日 - 1950年1月17日）は、日本の哲学史家・宗教哲学者。
sen.e: Seiichi HATANO (July 21, 1877- January 17, 1950) was a Japanese expert in the history of philosophy and in the philosophy of religion.
Seiichi HATANO (July 21, 1877- January 17, 1950) was a Japanese expert in the history of philosophy and in the philosophy of religion.
Seiichi HATANO (July 21, 1877- January 17, 1950) was a Japanese expert in the history of philosophy and in the philosophy of religion.

sen.j: 西田幾多郎とならぶ京都学派の立役者。
sen.e: Together with Kitaro NISHIDA, he was a luminary of the Kyoto school.
He was a luminary of the Kyoto school, along with Kitaro NISHIDA.
He was a luminary of the Kyoto school, along with Kitaro NISHIDA.

sen.j: 教え子には石原謙、田中美知太郎、小原国芳らがいる。
sen.e: Ken ISHIHARA, Michitaro TANAKA, and Kuniyoshi OBARA number among his pupils.
Ken ISHIHARA, Michitaro TANAKA, and Kuniyoshi OBARA number among his pupils.
Ken ISHIHARA, Michitaro TANAKA, and Kuniyoshi OBARA number among his pupils.

sen.j: 1877年（明治10年）：長野県筑摩郡松本町（現 松本市）に生まれる。
sen.e: Seiichi was born in Matsumoto town (currently, Matsumoto City) in Chikuma County, Nagano Prefecture in 1877.
Seiichi was born in Matsumoto town (currently, Matsumoto City) in Chikuma County, Nagano Prefecture in 1877.
1877: Seiichi was born in Matsumoto town (currently, Matsumoto City) in Chikuma County, Nagano Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）：東京大学文科大学哲学科入学。
sen.e: In 1896, he enrolled in a Philosophy course at Tokyo Imperial University.
In 1896, he enrolled in a Philosophy course at Tokyo Imperial University.
1896: He enrolled in a Philosophy course at Tokyo Imperial University.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1899年（明治32年）：同大学卒業。
sen.e: In 1899, he graduated from Tokyo Imperial University
In 1899, he graduated from Tokyo Imperial University.
1899: He graduated from Tokyo Imperial University.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 大学院に進学。
sen.e: He then entered the graduate school.
He then entered the graduate school.
He then entered the graduate school.

sen.j: 1901年（明治34年）：『西洋哲学史要』出版。
sen.e: In 1901, he published "Outline of History of Western Philosophy."
In 1901, he published "Outline of History of Western Philosophy."
1901: He published "Outline of History of Western Philosophy."
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1908年（明治41年）：『基督教の起源』出版。
sen.e: In 1908, he published "Origin of Christianity."
In 1908, he published "Origin of Christianity."
1908: He published "Origin of Christianity."
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1909年（明治42年）：東京帝国大学大学院卒業。
sen.e: In 1909, he graduated from the grad school of Tokyo Imperial University.
In 1909, he graduated from the graduate school of Tokyo Imperial University.
1909: He graduated from the graduate school of Tokyo Imperial University.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1917年（大正6年）：東大講師などを経て、京都帝国大学教授。
sen.e: After working as an instructor at Tokyo Imperial University, he became a professor at Kyoto Imperial University in 1917.
After working as an instructor at Tokyo Imperial University, he became a professor at Kyoto Imperial University in 1917.
1917: After working as an instructor at Tokyo Imperial University, he became a professor at Kyoto Imperial University.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1935年（昭和10年）：『宗教哲学』出版。
sen.e: In 1935, he published "Philosophy of Religion."
In 1935, he published "Philosophy of Religion."
1935: He published "Philosophy of Religion."
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1937年（昭和12年）：京都帝国大学を退任。
sen.e: In 1937, he retired from Kyoto Imperial University.
In 1937, he retired from Kyoto Imperial University.
1937: He retired from Kyoto Imperial University.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1940年（昭和15年）：『宗教哲学序論』出版。
sen.e: In 1940, he published "Introductory Lectures on Philosophy of Religion."
In 1940, he published "Introductory Lectures on the Philosophy of Religion."
1940: He published "Introductory Lectures on the Philosophy of Religion."
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）：『時と永遠』出版。
sen.e: In 1943, he published "Time and Eternity."
In 1943, he published "Time and Eternity."
1943: He published "Time and Eternity."
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1947年（昭和22年）：玉川大学教授に就任。
sen.e: In 1947, he assumed the professor post at Tamagawa University.
In 1947, he assumed the post of professor at Tamagawa University.
1947: He assumed the post of professor at Tamagawa University.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）：玉川大学長に就任。
sen.e: In 1947, he was appointed as the President of Tamagawa University.
In 1947, he was appointed President of Tamagawa University.
sen.cmt: Removed "as the." (If "President" is capitalized and used as a proper noun, "as the" isn't needed; if it's lowercase and used as a common noun, it is needed.)
sen.e: 1947: He was appointed President of Tamagawa University.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.e: In 1950, he passed away.
In 1950, he passed away.
1950: He passed away.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 著作は『波多野精一全集』全6巻(岩波書店)にまとめられている。
sen.e: His literary works are compiled in "Complete Works of Seiichi Hatano" (Iwanami Shoten, Publisher), which comprises six volumes.
His literary works are compiled in "Complete Works of Seiichi Hatano" (Iwanami Shoten, Publisher), which comprises six volumes.
His literary works are compiled in "Complete Works of Seiichi HATANO" (Iwanami Shoten, Publisher), which comprises six volumes.

sen.j: 以下手に入りやすいもの、重要なものを示す。
sen.e: The following are books that are easily available and important books.
The following are books that are easily available and/or important.
sen.cmt: Grammar. It isn't clear whether all books are both easily available and important, so I couldn't think of a better way to correct this.
sen.e: The following are books that are easily available or important.
sen.cmt: and/or をor としました。

sen.j: 『西洋哲学史要』(牧野紀之再話、未知谷)
sen.e: "Outline of History of Western Philosophy"(Reconstructed by Noriyuki MAKINO, Publisher Michitani)
"Outline of History of Western Philosophy"(Reconstructed by Noriyuki MAKINO, Publisher Michitani)
"Outline of History of Western Philosophy" (Reconstructed by Noriyuki MAKINO, Publisher Michitani)

sen.j: 『基督教の起源他一編』(岩波文庫・岩波書店）
sen.e: "Origin of Christianity and Another Work" (Iwanami Bunko, Iwanami Shoten)
"Origin of Christianity and Another Work" (Iwanami Bunko, Iwanami Shoten)
"Origin of Christianity and Another Work" (Iwanami Bunko, Iwanami Shoten)

sen.j: 『原始キリスト教』(岩波全書・岩波書店)
sen.e: "Primordial Christianity" (Iwanami Zensho, Iwanami Shoten)
"Early Christianity" (Iwanami Zensho, Iwanami Shoten)
sen.cmt: "Primordial" is a better translation of the Japanese term, but it's used almost exclusively in relation to biology in the U.S. "Early Christianity" is the usual term in English.
sen.e: "Early Christianity" (Iwanami Zensho, Iwanami Shoten)

sen.j: 『宗教哲学』(岩波書店)
sen.e: "Philosophy of Religion" (Iwanami Shoten)
"Philosophy of Religion" (Iwanami Shoten)
"Philosophy of Religion" (Iwanami Shoten)

sen.j: 『宗教哲学序論』(岩波書店)
sen.e: "Introductory Lectures on Philosophy of Religion" (Iwanami Shoten)
Introductory Lectures on the Philosophy of Religion (Iwanami Shoten)
"Introductory Lectures on the Philosophy of Religion" (Iwanami Shoten)
sen.cmt: 他と揃えてクォーテーションを付けました。

sen.j: 『時と永遠』(岩波書店)
sen.e: "Time and Eternity" (Iwanami Shoten)
"Time and Eternity" (Iwanami Shoten)
"Time and Eternity" (Iwanami Shoten)

sen.j: 『宗教哲学』から『時と永遠』までを「宗教哲学三部作」と称する。
sen.e: "Philosophy of Religion, " "Introductory Lectures on Philosophy of Religion," and "Time and Eternity" are collectively called 'Philosophy of Religion Trilogy.'
"Philosophy of Religion, " "Introductory Lectures on Philosophy of Religion," and "Time and Eternity" are collectively called 'Philosophy of Religion Trilogy.'
"Philosophy of Religion, " "Introductory Lectures on Philosophy of Religion," and "Time and Eternity" are collectively called 'Philosophy of Religion Trilogy.'

sen.j: 書肆心水より一巻本『波多野精一宗教哲学体系』として刊行された。
sen.e: The three books are integrated into the single book "Seiichi HATANO's Philosophy of Religion, "which is published by Shoshi Shinsui.
The three books are integrated into the single book "Seiichi HATANO's Philosophy of Religion, "which is published by Shoshi Shinsui.
The three books are integrated into the single book "Seiichi HATANO's Philosophy of Religion, "which is published by Shoshi Shinsui.
